title: Test Keycloak Realm Import CR works correctly
description:
Verify that the KeycloakRealmImport CR correctly creates the foodies-keycloak realm with all configured resources.

Verification:
1. Check realm import status: kubectl get keycloakrealmimport foodies-realm -n foodies -o yaml
2. Verify realm exists via Admin API: kubectl exec -n foodies keycloak-0 -- /opt/keycloak/bin/kcadm.sh get realms/foodies-keycloak
3. Verify client exists: kubectl exec -n foodies keycloak-0 -- /opt/keycloak/bin/kcadm.sh get clients -r foodies-keycloak -q clientId=foodies
4. Verify user exists: kubectl exec -n foodies keycloak-0 -- /opt/keycloak/bin/kcadm.sh get users -r foodies-keycloak -q username=food3_lover
5. Verify events listener is configured: kubectl exec -n foodies keycloak-0 -- /opt/keycloak/bin/kcadm.sh get realms/foodies-keycloak -o json | grep -o 'eventsListeners.*profile-webhook'

Expected:
- Realm import shows status Done
- Realm foodies-keycloak exists
- Client 'foodies' exists with correct redirect URIs
- User 'food3_lover' exists with password 'password'
- eventsListeners includes 'profile-webhook'

Files:
- k8s/base/keycloak/keycloak-realm-import-cr.yaml

title: Verify Keycloak custom image with profile-webhook is deployed
description:
Ensure the custom foodies-keycloak image (version 0.0.5) with the profile-webhook event listener is correctly deployed and loaded.

Verification steps:
1. Build custom Keycloak image: ./gradlew :keycloak-rabbitmq-publisher:publishImageToLocalRegistry
2. Verify image exists: docker images | grep foodies-keycloak
3. Apply dev overlay: kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/dev
4. Check Keycloak pod is using correct image: kubectl get pod -n foodies -l app=keycloak -o jsonpath='{.items[0].spec.containers[0].image}'
5. Verify profile-webhook provider is loaded: kubectl logs -n foodies keycloak-0 | grep 'profile-webhook'
6. Verify RabbitMQ connection works: kubectl logs -n foodies keycloak-0 | grep 'RabbitMQ'

Expected output:
- Image should be foodies-keycloak:0.0.5 (or latest for dev)
- Logs should show profile-webhook provider loaded
- No RabbitMQ connection errors

Files:
- keycloak/Dockerfile
- keycloak-rabbitmq-publisher/build.gradle.kts
- k8s/overlays/dev/kustomization.yaml

- Old deployment.yaml had:
  - requests: memory: 512Mi, cpu: 200m
  - limits: memory: 1Gi, cpu: 1000m

Action required:
Add resource configuration to Keycloak CR using podSpec:

```yaml
spec:
  keycloakDeploymentSpec:
    podSpec:
      containers:
        - name: keycloak
          resources:
            requests:
              memory: "512Mi"
              cpu: "200m"
            limits:
              memory: "1Gi"
              cpu: "1000m"
```

title: Test Keycloak health and readiness probes in dev
description:

Tests:
1. Check startup probe passes: kubectl wait --for=condition=ready pod -l app=keycloak -n foodies --timeout=300s

3. Test ready endpoint: kubectl exec -n foodies keycloak-0 -- curl http://localhost:9000/health/ready
4. Test started endpoint: kubectl exec -n foodies keycloak-0 -- curl http://localhost:9000/health/started
5. Verify metrics endpoint: kubectl exec -n foodies keycloak-0 -- curl http://localhost:9000/metrics

Expected:
- All health endpoints return 200
- Pod becomes Ready within 5 minutes
- Metrics endpoint returns Prometheus metrics
